item.title: Cobalt Strike
item.description: IoC Open TCP connection, port 50050 Get a default CS certificate Components For full information on how this works, see the article on Mandiant.

item.title: C&C Patterns
item.description: Network You will need pcap files for that: https://www.activecountermeasures.com/free-tools/rita/. Forward: attacker connects to the victim. Reverse: victim connects to the attacker (harder to detect).

item.title: Web Application Attack Patterns
item.description: This article is an attempt to collect the most of the web attacks in one place, collect the corresponding attack patterns.

item.title: WiFi Attacks

item.title: DoS
item.description: Some of the methods are outdates and can hardly be exploited. I list them here just our of interest.

item.title: Mobile Application Attacks
item.description: This article is only about attacks on the client. The server part of a mobile application falls under the Web Attacks section.

item.title: Reconnaissance And Enumeration
item.description: Scanning ‚öôÔ∏è Payload IoC You might see a series of short connections across a wide number of ports on the firewall, which would be indicative of a port scan in progress.

item.title: Web Attacks
item.description: Of course, there are lots of payloads out there. But I hope this section can give some idea of what to expect when dealing with web server/application attacks.
